intro: Asterothrix crispa, commonly known as the curly asterothrix, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its finely serrated, wavy leaves that give it a distinctive, ornamental appearance. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the cooler months. Asterothrix crispa is typically grown as a ornamental plant in gardens due to its unique foliage and modest flowering display.
